posts.post_content:
It's time to let this awkward template die; we have better technology today and it's called double strike. Yes, I know the untap + extra combat phase has its own unique combo potential. But just as we should make [Last Gasp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Last Gasp) instead of [Nameless Inversion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nameless Inversion) a core set staple, so should we make the following new card and start making cards based on it, instead of cards based on [Relentless Assault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relentless Assault).
  
   
"All creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn."
posts.html:
It's time to let this awkward template die; we have better technology today and it's called double strike. Yes, I know the untap + extra combat phase has its own unique combo potential. But just as we should make Last Gasp instead of Nameless Inversion a core set staple, so should we make the following new card and start making cards based on it, instead of cards based on Relentless Assault.

"All creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn."

posts.post_content:
Waves of Aggression is not better for every deck. Some decks don't care about the recursion and just want it to be in tempo with their 3 drop.  
  
Turn 1: [Goblin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Guide), Swing for 2  
Turn 2: Swing for 2, [Keldon Marauders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keldon Marauders)   
Turn 3: [Boggart Ram-Gang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Ram-Gang), Swing for 8.  
Turn 4: This... Swing for 16.
posts.html:
